alert.note: Alert for Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 4:08PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT/715 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in southeast Alabama, Henry. In southwest Georgia, Early. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT /715 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 308 PM CDT /408 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blakely, Headland, Newville, Haleburg, Miller, Barnes, Hardwickburg, Balkum, Hayes, Grandberry Crossroads, Tumbleton, Dancey and Headland Municipal A/P. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
